item.description:
Volunteer Information and Open House Night

Thursday, November 8th @ 6:30-8pm

Braintree Community Youth Center

74 Pond Street, Braintree

Join us as we offer tours and an information session about volunteer opportunities at the Braintree Community Youth Center!

There will be a formal presentation and q&a session from 7-7:45pm.

Individuals, friends, couples, groups and current volunteers are welcome!

This is a free event.

Refreshments will be provided.

Advance registration suggested but not required.

Unable to attend but interested in volunteering?

Fill out a volunteer form on our website @ www.braintreeyouthcenter.org/volunteer or email volunteer@braintreeyouthcenter.org.

http://bcycviohn.eventbrite.com/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Join us for an evening of volunteering at the Braintree Community Youth Center (BCYC). The Youth Center is open Fridays and Saturdays for Braintree teens in grades 6-12. It's a safe place for them to hang out and socialize with their friends.

 

As volunteers we oversee that they have a safe environment, interact with them and socialize with other volunteers. There are a few key roles for volunteers starting with the door greeter, a snack bar 'attendant' and then the rest of the volunteers are on the 'floor.' You will quickly and easily learn about all of these volunteer activities/roles and can decide which one suits you best or try them all out. (If you would like to read volunteer descriptions please email me directly and allow me to reply directly to your email so I can attach the documents in my reply.) Various volunteers will help us out throughout the evening as we meet them all, learn the different roles of volunteers and meet some of the teens.

 

Some of the activities that can be enjoyed at the Youth Center are pool, ping pong, large flat-screen tv w/ surround sound (this is sooo cool), xbox and other video game systems, snacks and drinks, games, or just lounging around and socializing. We as volunteers can enjoy these amenities as well, either with the teens or with each other. (I personally have played ping pong and pool with both teens and volunteers.)

 

This is a fun inexpensive night out (or in, depending on how you look at it) with friends. As volunteers we get free snacks so it only costs you time (and maybe some transportation money). If you decide you would like to volunteer at the youth Center again you can let one of the regular volunteers know and then you will be asked to fill out a volunteer information form along with a CORI check. Come on out for a fun inexpensive evening with new friends!

 

Tonight you will meet current, new and potential volunteers as we give you information on volunteer opportunities at the Braintree Community Youth Center.

 

Connect with The Boston Volunteers our Facebook page: http://on.FB.me/guKc6...

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 

Volunteer Information & Open House Night @ The Braintree Community Youth Center
Thursday, November 8th @ 6:30-8pm
74 Pond Street 
Braintree, MA 02184
781-228-5361
www.braintreeyouthcenter.org

Free Registration Website: http://bcycviohn.eventbrite.com/


Meeting Place: Inside the Youth Center. Please sign-in at the check-in desk on the 1st floor and come on up and join us on the 2nd floor.

Event Organizer(s): Angela

Note: You are more than welcome to RSVP w. the Boston Volunteers.  However, you are welcome to RSVP on the eventbrite page as well (and would appreciate it).  Please RSVP only if you are 98% sure you can attend as space is limited.

Min/Max: Min of 4 participants (including the Event Organizer) by 6pm on Friday, November 2nd.  Max of 20 people.

Guests: Welcome, 1 per member!

Ages: Volunteers must be 21+. The BCYC allows volunteers over the age of 20 but if we decided to go out it is easier if everyone is 21+.

RSVP Deadline: Thursday, November 8th @ Noon (Any changes made after this time may not be seen by the Event Organizers until after the event.)  You can still register on the eventbrite page.

In Case of Inclement Weather: This event will take place rain or shine. In case of severe weather forecasts, please check back here on Tuesday or Wednesday for an update on weather conditions.

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 

Directions:

Overview: The BCYC is located on Pond Street, approximately 1 mile from Braintree High School and the T and highway. It is one of two brick buildings next to a cemetary across from Sunset Lake.

From North of Braintree: Take Route 93/95/128 to Route 3 South.

From Route 3: Take Exit 17/Union Street, Braintree.  Exit the Rotary heading towards the T and Bickford's and South Braintree.  Go straight through the 1st light keeping the T on your left.  Go up the hill and take a left at the next light onto Washington Street.  Follow straight thru 2 sets of lights passing Town Hall on your right.  At the next set of lights take a right, which is still Washington Street.  (Rite-Aid is at this intersection.  It will be to your left at the light and behind you after you make the turn.)  Take a left at the next light (onto Route 37S) keeping Braintree Cooperative Bank on your left.  Take a right at the next light onto Pond Street.  74 Pond Street is 1/4 mile up on the left next to a cemetary.  It is one of two brick buildings.  Park on the side.

From the Braintree T: Follow directions above on foot.
item.how_to_find_us: Check-in at the front door and then join us on the 2nd floor.

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Volunteer Information & Open House Night @ the Braintree Community Youth Center
